title: SpaceX wants to boost Hubble Space Telescope’s orbit with Dragon spacecraft
summary: NASA and SpaceX have signed a Space Act Agreement to study the feasibility of boosting the orbit of the iconic Hubble Space...

title: NASA and SpaceX are studying a Hubble telescope boost, adding 15 to 20 years of life
summary: "It's doing great science as we speak."

title: First ViaSat-3 enters environmental testing
summary: Viasat said Sept. 29 its inaugural ViaSat-3 satellite has started environmental tests after being put into flight configuration for the first time.

title: NASA Awards Contract for Acquisition of Gaseous, Liquid Helium
summary: NASA has selected three companies to supply 1.4 million liters of liquid helium and 87.7 million standard cubic feet of gaseous helium for use at facilities across the agency.

title: Hungary’s 4iG to buy a majority of Spacecom in stages
summary: 4iG, a Hungarian provider of terrestrial communications, plans to buy a majority stake in Israeli satellite operator Spacecom in stages following resistance from Israel’s government.

title: Kendall: Power competition in space becoming more destabilizing
summary: Air Force Secretary Frank Kendall said China and Russia "have been working on offensive capability to counter our space systems."

title: Majority of tracked Russian ASAT debris has deorbited
summary: Nearly two-thirds of the debris tracked from last year’s Russian anti-satellite (ASAT) test has since deorbited, but it could take more than a decade for the rest to reenter.

title: Russian Soyuz brings three cosmonauts home from space station
summary: Three cosmonauts undocked from the International Space Station Thursday and returned to Earth aboard their Soyuz spacecraft, safely landing on the steppe of Kazakhstan to wrap up a 195-day mission.

title: Juno swoops past Europa, revealing the mysterious, icy world [Updated]
Firefly scrubs launch attempt for second Alpha flight
summary: Firefly scrubbed its launch of FLTA002 – its second demonstration flight of the Alpha launch vehicle – on the mission dubbed “To The Black.”
